results.title: Life in northern lands: Norway
results.brief_description: A Norwegian farm family, living near Bergen, illustrate how people in a northerly latitude adjust their lives and seasonal occupations to the demands of climate and topography. The family is seen harvesting hay and grains during the short Norwegian summer. In the winter-time children sky to school and their brothers and fathers are busy fishing and cutting timber.

results.title: Life in Mediterranean lands: California
results.brief_description: Explains the natural causes of a Mediterranean type of climate, using as an example the coastal strip of southern California. Shows how people there live and adapt themselves to the climate, and describes the plant and animal life of the area.

results.title: Life in Lost Creek: fresh water ecology
results.creator_credit: Bruce Russell, Biomedia Associates and Coronet Films
results.brief_description: Investigates fast-moving, slow-moving, and standing freshwater ecosystems. Examines, through underwater photography and photomicrography, living organisms, their adaptations and their interactions within each habitat.

results.title: Life in hot wet lands: the Congo Basin
results.brief_description: Set in the Congo Basin, this film illustrates how climate influences the lives of people who live in hot, wet lands. Follows the daily activities of a jungle boy and his family showing how they adapt their clothing, shelters, social activities and food gathering to the geographical region in which they live.

results.title: Life in hot rain forests: Amazon Basin
results.brief_description: The climate factors that cause a tropical rain forest; how small communities of people of mixed Indian and Portuguese blood living along the Amazon river adapt themselves to this kind of environment. Views of a family tending their small garden, preparing meals, and gathering products from the forest for trade.

results.title: Life in hot dry lands: California
results.brief_description: In a land devoid of rain all forms of life must struggle to survive. This film tells the story of the battle waged in the desert lands by the starving plant life, the animals, and the human beings who adapt themselves to the existence. Demonstrates where the desert area of the world are located and explains why they are barren wastelands.

results.title: Life in grasslands: Argentine pampas
results.brief_description: A visit to the home of a family living in the Argentine pampas, showing family and community life on this representative grassland. The climate and geography of the Argentine pampas; its abundant food crops, cattle and sheep.

results.title: Life in cold lands: Eskimo village
results.brief_description: Fishing, seal hunting, trapping animals for fur, putting up the tent which is their summer home, shopping in the village store - these are among the common activities in the life of the Agootuk family. Eskimos of Unalakleet, Alaska. Through this intimate study of the family at its daily tasks, pupils become aware of the patterns of living persons whose environment is a cold land.

results.title: Life in Ancient Rome: the family
results.brief_description: Portrays the activities of a Roman boy and his family during a typical day in ancient Rome. Studies the children’s education and includes visits to the father’s shop and Roman baths. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Life in Ancient Rome
results.creator_credit: William Deneen and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Recreates typical scenes in Rome during the reign of Emperor Trajan. Examines characteristics and achievements of the Roman Empire at the height of its power. Discusses weaknesses in Roman society and the ways in which Roman ideas and culture influenced the development of Western civilisation. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
